statement:
If the functions $f$ and $g$ are holomorphic in a domain $D$ of the
complex plane and the equation $$\begin{aligned}
f(z) = g(z)\end{aligned}$$ is true in an infinite subset $S$ of $D$
having an accumulation point $z_0$ in $D$, then (1) is true in the whole
$D$.

**Remark.** The subset $S$ may be e.g. some neighbourhood of $z_0$ or
some arc containing $z_0$.
